abstract.text: An object that draws pages of content to print, with or without the assistance of print formatters.

inlineContent.text: A page renderer is an instance of a custom subclass of
. When you compose a print job using the shared instance of
, you assign the page renderer to the
property of that instance. The subclass typically overrides one or more of the five
methods.
The
by default calls each of the other draw methods, in the order listed below. Your app can override it if you want to have complete control over what to draw for printing.
Override
to draw content in the header.
Override
to draw the main content of the print job in the area between the header and the footer.
Override
to intermix custom drawing with the drawing that an associated print formatter performs. The system calls this method for each print formatter associated with a particular page.
Override
to draw content in the footer.
usually requires you to specify the number of pages of printable content by overriding
. It also allows you to specify the heights of page headers and footers.
You may assign one or more print formatters —
objects that can lay out printable content of a certain kind — to specific page ranges of the content. For example, if your printable content is partially HTML, you may assign an instance of the
object to the starting page of HTML content. You assign a print formatter using the
method and you can get the print formatters for a particular page by calling

abstract.text: Construct and manage a graphical, event-driven user interface for your iOS, iPadOS, or tvOS app.
An object that lays out HTML text for a multipage print job.
An abstract base class for print formatters, which are objects that lay out custom printable content that can cross page boundaries.
A user interface that manages the printing of documents, images, and other printable content in iOS.
An object that draws pages of printable content when UIKit requests it.
An object that draws pages of content to print, with or without the assistance of print formatters.
Adds a print formatter to the page renderer starting at the specified page.
Determines the actual print-rendering quality according to the requested rendering quality.
Draws the content of a page.
Draws the footer of a page.
Draws the header of a page.
Draws a page of content for the printer.
Performs custom drawing in addition to the specified print formatter’s drawing for a page.
The height of the page footer.
The height of the page header.
The number of pages to render.
The size of the paper for printing.
Prepares the renderer for drawing a range of pages.
The print formatters for the page renderer.
Returns the print formatters for a specified page.
The area in which printing can occur.
Constants that represent the rendering quality for a print operation.
Improve your iPadOS app with Mac Catalyst by supporting native controls, multiple windows, sharing, printing, menus and keyboard shortcuts.

doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKi.title: Building and improving your app with Mac Catalyst

abstract.text: The root class of most Objective-C class hierarchies, from which subclasses inherit a basic interface to the runtime system and the ability to behave as Objective-C objects.
The group of methods that are fundamental to all Objective-C objects.
A type that can be hashed into a `Hasher` to produce an integer hash value.
A type that can be compared for value equality.
A singleton actor whose executor is equivalent to the main dispatch queue.
A type with a customized textual representation.
A type with a customized textual representation suitable for debugging purposes.
A type whose instances can be encoded, and appropriately passed, as elements of a C `va_list`.
A thread-safe type whose values can be shared across arbitrary concurrent contexts without introducing a risk of data races.
